title: Roasted Butternut Squash Salad Recipe
description: This butternut squash salad with tender onions, crispy bacon, and toasted pecans is drizzled with maple syrup and served warm for a fabulous fall meal.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Vegetables Squash Winter Squash Butternut Squash Roasted Butternut Squash Salad 4.6 (7) 7 Reviews 4 Photos This butternut squash salad with raisins, onions, crispy bacon, and romaine lettuce is served warm. Simple and delicious! Submitted by Marcia Updated on October 16, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 4 4 4 Prep Time: 25 mins Cook Time: 35 mins Total Time: 1 hr Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 1 medium butternut squash, halved lengthwise and seeded 1 tablespoon olive oil, or as needed 6 slices bacon 1 cup sliced onion 8 cups chopped romaine lettuce ⅓ cup pecans, toasted and chopped ⅓ cup raisins 2 tablespoons maple syrup, or to taste Directions Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Brush cut sides of butternut squash with olive oil. Wrap each squash half tightly in aluminum foil. Roast squash halves in the preheated oven until they begin to soften, about 20 minutes. Remove squash from the oven and let sit until cool enough to handle. Remove foil and slice into 3/4-inch thick slices. Remove skin from each slice and cut into 3/4-inch cubes. Set aside 8 cups of the cubed squash, reserving any remaining squash for another use. Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until crispy, 10 to 12 minutes. Remove bacon and drain on paper towels. Add onions to the skillet and cook in the bacon grease for 2 to 3 minutes. Add 8 cups squash and cook, tossing occasionally, until onions are soft and beginning to caramelize, and squash cubes are tender, 10 to 15 minutes. Place romaine lettuce in a large serving bowl; crumble bacon on top and add pecans and raisins. Add butternut squash-onion mixture; toss to combine. Drizzle with maple syrup and serve warm. Recipe Tip You can cook the butternut squash on an outdoor grill over indirect heat, if you prefer. Add Your Photo Photos of Roasted Butternut Squash Salad 01 of 04 Photo by  Christina 02 of 04 Photo by  Danielle Jones 01/01/2025 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Love it! Nice main dish and good for meal planning as well. To remain compliant with my blood type and consecration, I substituted sweet potatoes, turkey sausage, blueberries, pumpkins seeds and date syrup. 03 of 04 Photo by  Paula 10/16/2023 I scaled this salad down to 1 person for my lunch today. The immediate flavor was sweet & salty. Then I got the crunch from the lettuce, nuts, and crispy bacon. I absolutely love butternut squash, so this salad checked ALL the boxes for me! 04 of 04 Photo by  Christina 11/17/2019 This salad screams fall and is absolutely delicious! Instead of drizzling it with just plain maple syrup, I made 'maple vinegarette' from this site and it was amazing! I will definitely be making this again-yum! name: Marcia

Wrap each squash half tightly in aluminum foil.;Roast squash halves in the preheated oven until they begin to soften, about 20 minutes. Remove squash from the oven and let sit until cool enough to handle. Remove foil and slice into 3/4-inch thick slices. Remove skin from each slice and cut into 3/4-inch cubes. Set aside 8 cups of the cubed squash, reserving any remaining squash for another use.;Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until crispy, 10 to 12 minutes. Remove bacon and drain on paper towels. Add onions to the skillet and cook in the bacon grease for 2 to 3 minutes. Add 8 cups squash and cook, tossing occasionally, until onions are soft and beginning to caramelize, and squash cubes are tender, 10 to 15 minutes.;Place romaine lettuce in a large serving bowl; crumble bacon on top and add pecans and raisins. Add butternut squash-onion mixture; toss to combine. Drizzle with maple syrup and serve warm.
